citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Hazardous Materials Response Assessment Division
citeinfo.title: Environmentally Sensitive Areas - PWS

descript.abstract: Data Type: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill; This is a series of four seasonal maps with a broad overview of the environmentally sensitive resources of Prince William Sound that would receive priority attention during oil spill planning and response. Resources depicted were chosen on the basis of high sensitivity to spilled oil, high vulnerability to oil spills or special management status. Also a series of 42 maps at 1:63360 with similar data.

idinfo.accconst: Seasonal maps are available to the public free of charge, 1:63,360 maps are available but are very limited production. Maps can be copied.
idinfo.useconst: Not to be used for navigational purposes.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
